theresa ma

a developer in development

    • Hey, hi -

    I'm Theresa. I'm a third year student at the University of Toronto, completing a specialist in computer science (w/a focus in artificial intelligence + web & internet technologies), major in cognitive science (I want to read your mind), & minor in philosophy (what does any of this even mean?). Right now I'm really interested web design & development, but I make other things too (like really good mashed potatoes). Drop me a note & maybe we could make something together.

    tl;dr: nice to meet you.

    Work / Projects

    StackAdapt Dashboard Redesign

    July 2014

    The complete redesign & development of the StackAdapt client dashboard user interface optimizes the user experience for quick & intuitive overview of site and campaign data for publishers and advertisers. It features a beautifully interactive JavaScript chart using the amCharts library.

    Ghost theme for StackAdapt Blog

    August 2014

    A custom theme using the Ghost platform, developed for StackAdapt's company blog. Responsive layout suitable for desktop, tablet, and mobile.

    Features search, thumbnail cropping, social sidebar, and custom in-post tweet tips.

    to end of days

    May 2012

    Arrangements for concert band of selections from Howard Shore's Lord of the Rings Soundtrack (scored for: flute, oboe, Bb clarinet, alto sax, tenor sax, french horn, Bb trumpet, trombone, baritone, tuba, double bass, timpani, suspended cymbal, bells)

    Part 1 (~3mins): The Riders of Rohan into Breaking of the Fellowship (In Dreams)
    Part 2(~9mins): Forth Eorlingas, The White Tree, The Riders of Rohan, The Ring Goes South, The Breaking of the Fellowship (In Dreams)

    Hide

    Details

    another brick in the wall

    April 2014

    Classic brick breaker arcade game implemented using Verilog Hardware Description Language, built for the Altera DE2 FPGA. Features three difficulty levels and start/pause/restart functions.

    Developed as the final project for CSC258H1 to demonstrate finite state machines, synchronous circuits, sequential circuits, and operations with signed binary.

    Available on GitHub
